messages: a56fa0c3deae734281ab1ac3fd9ee148 (23:25): Can someone explain what is going on with "RootNamespace" in the csproj file? If I create a reference to a webservice I have to specify this rootNamespace.WebserviceName...I'd rather just access WebserviceName directly

78dbc21d2902c96d3067f18f609ca04c (23:29): bbtech? setting the root namespace will err well set the root namespace ... if you want to access a type without fully qualifying it then use a using statement
a56fa0c3deae734281ab1ac3fd9ee148 (23:30): It seems to me that if I make a reference to a web service and give that reference a name...that should be the only importing necessary?
78dbc21d2902c96d3067f18f609ca04c (23:31): and the code generated to access that service is placed in the root namespace?
a56fa0c3deae734281ab1ac3fd9ee148 (23:33): How can I see/rename the root namespace?
a56fa0c3deae734281ab1ac3fd9ee148 (23:34): modifying the csproj file doesn't seem to do it

31013fcdc90abc8e9a08a3651fc8439c (23:35): hi. how can I get StreamReader out of Socket? the page I'm reading syas I should do stream = new sock.GetStream(); but compiler says that sock does not have GetStream definition.
